title: Easeout Weekly #16
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![Compressed CSS](/images/uploads/brotli-css.png) [How I Used Brotli to Get Even Smaller CSS and JavaScript Files at CDN Scale](https://css-tricks.com/how-i-used-brotli-to-get-even-smaller-css-and-javascript-files-at-cdn-scale/) This article takes a look at using Brotli on a production scale, showing how it can be very economical and can saves costs on many fronts. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/how-i-used-brotli-to-get-even-smaller-css-and-javascript-files-at-cdn-scale/)
![Design Effectiveness Article](/images/uploads/design-test-effectiveness.png) [How To Test A Design Concept For Effectiveness](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/test-design-concept-effectiveness/) Getting a client or stakeholder to approve a design concept can be challenging. However, testing can make it easier, as well as ensuring you have the right solution. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/test-design-concept-effectiveness/)
![Newspaper Stack](/images/uploads/newspaper-stack.png) [A Primer on Display Advertising for Web Designers](https://css-tricks.com/a-primer-on-display-advertising-for-web-designers/) This article looks at some options where we might consider or commonly expect to place advertisements in webpages, then moves into styling strategies. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/a-primer-on-display-advertising-for-web-designers/)
![React Startup Screen](/images/uploads/rest-api-react-fetch-axios-initial-app-screen.png) [Consuming REST APIs In React With Fetch And Axios](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/rest-api-react-fetch-axios/) Shedrack Akintayo explains what a REST API is and how to build a simple application that consumes a REST API by using both Fetch API and Axios. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/rest-api-react-fetch-axios/)
![Inclusive Design Principles](/images/uploads/equivalent-experiences-inclusive-design-principles.png) [Equivalent Experiences: Thinking Equivalently](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/equivalent-experiences-part2/) This article addresses some common accessibility issues, and looks at how to best go about improving them so everyone can effortlessly access your content. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/equivalent-experiences-part2/)
![Webmentions Logo](/images/uploads/webmentions.png) [Jumping Into Webmentions With NextJS (or Not)](https://css-tricks.com/jumping-into-webmentions-with-nextjs-or-not/) A guide to working with Webmentions: Defining an endpoint, Processing social media, Getting mentions & Setting outbound mentions. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/jumping-into-webmentions-with-nextjs-or-not/)
![Keyframes Animations Article](/images/uploads/delay-animations.png) [A New Way to Delay Keyframes Animations](https://css-tricks.com/a-new-way-to-delay-keyframes-animations/) A look at some common issues surrounding delay animations & how to handle them effectively. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/a-new-way-to-delay-keyframes-animations/)
![Podcast Card](/images/uploads/smashing-podcast-episode-17.png) [Smashing Podcast Ep. 17: What’s New In Drupal 9?](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/smashing-podcast-episode-17/) In this episode of the Smashing Podcast, we’re taking a look at what’s new in Drupal 9. What are the major upcoming changes to this nearly 20-year-old open-source project? [Listen up ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/smashing-podcast-episode-17/)
![Click! Here Book ](/images/uploads/click-smashing-book.png) [Click! Here: Meet Our New Smashing Book](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/encouraging-clicks-book-release/) Meet “*Click!*”, Smashing Magazines' new guide on how to build trust, increase conversion and boost business KPIs effectively — without alienating people along the way. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/encouraging-clicks-book-release/)
![React Error Handling](/images/uploads/react-error-reporting-sentry.png) [React Error Handling And Reporting With Error Boundary And Sentry](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/react-error-handling-reporting-error-boundary-sentry/) This tutorial explores the concept of error boundaries in a React application. Showing how we can use error boundaries to deliver a better app experience & how to integrate Sentry for realtime error reporting. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/react-error-handling-reporting-error-boundary-sentry/)
![Jen Simmons Podcast Talk](/images/uploads/shoptalk-415.png) [CSS Aspect Ratio, Rendering Engines, and More with Jen Simmons](https://shoptalkshow.com/415/) Jen Simmons is back on the show to talk about her new HTML Essentials course, CSS Aspect Ratio, rendering engines vs browsers, and a big announcement from her personally! [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/415/)
![Rotated Table Column Headers Example](/images/uploads/slanted-table-headers.png) [Rotated Table Column Headers… Now With Fewer Magic Numbers!](https://css-tricks.com/rotated-table-column-headers-now-with-fewer-magic-numbers/) This guide shows us how we can rotate column headers without the trigonometry. By replacing it with some careful geometry and removing magic numbers. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/rotated-table-column-headers-now-with-fewer-magic-numbers/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
